alert.note: Alert for Crowley County Including Ordway; Eastern Las Animas County Including Pinon Canyon; Otero County Including La Junta and Western Comanche Grasslands; Pueblo County Including Pueblo; Western Las Animas County Including Trinidad and Thatcher (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 10 at 4:00AM MDT until April 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A Red Flag Warning remains in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM Today for gusty winds and low humidity value for fire weather zones 221, 222, 224 and 226 through 233, which includes the San Luis Valley, Fremont County, Teller County, the I-25 corridor, and Crowley, Otero and eastern las Animas counties... ...A Fire Weather Watch has been issued for Monday afternoon and evening for for gusty winds and low humidity value for fire weather zones 227...228...229...230...231...232...233...233 and 237...which includes most of the eastern plains on southeast Colorado... ...A Fire Weather Watch has been issued for Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening for for gusty winds and low humidity value for fire weather zones 228...229...230...231...232...233...234... 235...236...and 237 which includes most of the eastern plains of Southeast Colorado... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 228...230...231...232 AND 233... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 228...230...231...232 AND 233... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 228...230...231...232 AND 233... The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 228...230...231...232 and 233. * Winds...Southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * Timing...11 AM MDT to 8 PM MDT Sunday and Monday afternoon and evening and Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening... * Relative Humidity...As low as 8 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
